com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents

Class OperationRecordDocument

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.OperationRecordDocument
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PluginDocument, XMLSerializable, XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible

    public class OperationRecordDocument
extends Object
implements PluginDocument, XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible
    Stores references to the input and output documents a from single DocumentOperation. May additionally specify the operation and its parameters to enable the descendants to be reproduced, in which case it is referred to as an "active link".

    Geneious automatically creates an OperationRecordDocument with inactive links for every DocumentOperation that is run. OperationRecordDocuments are stored wrapped in AnnotatedPluginDocuments in a hidden area of the user's database.

    To obtain the URNs of hidden AnnotatedPluginDocuments containing OperationRecordDocuments use AnnotatedPluginDocument.getParentOperationRecord or AnnotatedPluginDocument.getDescendantOperationRecords. DocumentUtilities.getDocumentByURN(URN) can then be used to get hold of the document.

    If the DocumentOperation wants to create active links, it should use OperationCallback.setOptionsForActivelyLinkedDescendants and implement DocumentOperation.getOptions.

    Alternatively, if non-DocumentOperation code wants to create linked documents, it should construct a new OperationRecordDocument and then call linkDocumentsInDatabase(jebl.util.ProgressListener)

    Since:
    API 5.60 (Geneious 5.6.0)

      • OperationRecordDocument

        public OperationRecordDocument()
        PluginDocument deserialization constructor. One of the other constructors should be used for creating new operation records.

      • OperationRecordDocument

        public OperationRecordDocument(List<URN> inputDocuments,
                       String operationId,
                       long timeAtWhichOperationWasRun)
        Creates an operation record whose documents added later using addOutputDocument(URN) will be inactively linked (see hasAnyActiveLinks())
        Parameters:
        inputDocuments - the input documents to the operation.
        operationId - the id of the operation returned from getUniqueId(). This may be an invisible DocumentOperation (one that returns NotPresent from DocumentOperation.getActionOptions().GeneiousActionOptions.getMainMenuLocation()
        timeAtWhichOperationWasRun - the start time of the operation - get from System.currentTimeMillis().

        timeAtWhichOperationWasRun - the start time of the operation - get from System.currentTimeMillis().

        timeAtWhichOperationWasRun - the start time of the operation - get from System.currentTimeMillis().
        optionsForRecreatingDescendants - information necessary to rerun the operation. See DocumentOperation.OperationCallback#setOptionsForActivelyLinkedDescendants(org.jdom.Element, java.util.List, java.util.List).

    • Method Detail

      • addOutputDocument

        public void addOutputDocument(URN outputDocument)
        adds an output document that this operation produced. You should be sure to call setFinishedAddingOutputDocuments() when all output documents have been added.
        Parameters:
        outputDocument - an output document that this operation produced

      • removeOutputDocument

        public void removeOutputDocument(URN outputDocument)
        Removes an output document from the record. In most cases, using setOutputDocumentActive(URN, boolean) is preferable so that the user still has a record of what happened. At the time of writing, the only situation in which this should be used is when duplicating an operation record as a result of a copy/paste or import operation.
        Parameters:
        outputDocument - the URN of an existing output document. Its entry in the list of output documents will be replaced with null.

      • setFinishedAddingOutputDocuments

        public void setFinishedAddingOutputDocuments()
        tells this Operation Record that we're done adding documents via addOutputDocument(URN).
        See Also:
        isFinishedAddingOutputDocuments()

      • isFinishedAddingOutputDocuments

        public boolean isFinishedAddingOutputDocuments()
        Returns:
        whether we have finished adding output documents to this Operation Record or not. In order for viewers not to render an incomplete Operation Record, we need to know what all of the output documents are before we can do this.
        See Also:
        setFinishedAddingOutputDocuments()

      • hasAnyActiveLinks

        public boolean hasAnyActiveLinks()
        Returns:
        if this OperationRecordDocument has any actively linked descendants - ie the descendants should be reproduced when the parent document(s) are changed. In order for this to be the case, the operation id and parameters must also have been stored. Inactive links generally exist for historical purposes, to show when an operation was run and on what documents. An operation that is rerun must generate the same number of documents and those documents must be in the same order to ensure actively links correctly work.

      • getInputDocuments

        public List<URN> getInputDocuments()
        Returns:
        all the input documents to the operation that should be passed into performOperation. See DocumentOperation.OperationCallback#setOptionsForActivelyLinkedDescendants(org.jdom.Element, java.util.List, java.util.List). These are not necessarily all the parent documents, see getAdditionalParentDocuments(). The list will not be null, but individual elements in the list may (or maybe not) be null if documents have been deleted.
        See Also:
        getAdditionalParentDocuments(), getParentDocuments()

      • getAdditionalParentDocuments

        public List<URN> getAdditionalParentDocuments()
        Returns:
        any additional parent documents required for the operation to be rerun. See DocumentOperation.OperationCallback#setOptionsForActivelyLinkedDescendants(org.jdom.Element, java.util.List, java.util.List). The list will not be null, but individual elements in the list may (or maybe not) be null if documents have been deleted.
        See Also:
        getInputDocuments(), getParentDocuments()

      • getParentDocuments

        public final List<URN> getParentDocuments()
        Returns:
        all parent documents - this is just a concatenation of getInputDocuments() and getAdditionalParentDocuments(). The list will not be null, but individual elements in the list may (or maybe not) be null if documents have been deleted.
        See Also:
        getInputDocuments(), getAdditionalParentDocuments()

      • getOutputDocuments

        public List<URN> getOutputDocuments()
        Returns:
        the output documents from the operation. The list will not be null, but individual elements in the list may (or maybe not) be null if documents have been deleted. The URNs may refer to a document that no longer exists.
        See Also:
        getActiveOutputDocuments()

      • getActiveOutputDocuments

        public List<URN> getActiveOutputDocuments()
        Returns:
        the actively linked output documents from the operation. This list will never be null and will be the same as the list returned from getOutputDocuments() except that additional elements in the list may be null if the link between this operation and that output document is inactive.
        See Also:
        getOutputDocuments()

      • getOperationId

        public String getOperationId()
        Returns:
        the unique ID of the operation (returned from getUniqueId())

        public String getAdditionalInformation()
        Returns:
        additional information specific to the operation record or null if no additional information was specified.
        Since:
        API 4.910 (Geneious 9.1.0)

        public org.jdom.Element getOptionsForRecreatingDescendants()

      • getDisplayableFields

        public List<DocumentField> getDisplayableFields()
        Description copied from interface: PluginDocument
        A list of columns for display in the main document panel. This function only defines the columns available to display, not the particular values of these columns, which are returned by PluginDocument.getFieldValue(String).

        Each column is specified by a Field. The fields should be obtained from a call to the appropriate Field.createXXXXField, where XXXX is the appropriate type.

        While it is not required, it is recommended that a PluginDocument handle returning a complete list of its displayable fields before the document has been properly constructed via a call to XMLSerializable.fromXML(org.jdom.Element) The returned list need not and should not be modifiable.

        Specified by:
        getDisplayableFields in interface PluginDocument
        Returns:
        a list of document fields (or null to indicate no displayable fields)

      • getFieldValue

        public Object getFieldValue(String fieldCodeName)
        Description copied from interface: PluginDocument
        Get the value of a particular field.
        Specified by:
        getFieldValue in interface PluginDocument
        Parameters:
        fieldCodeName - field code. This should be the code of one of the fields returned from PluginDocument.getDisplayableFields().
        Returns:
        value for a field or null if this document does not have a field with the given field code. The class of the returned value must be the DocumentField.getValueType() (or a subclass) of the corresponding DocumentField returned from PluginDocument.getDisplayableFields().

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Description copied from interface: PluginDocument
        A short name (preferably one or two words) for the document.

        If this PluginDocument is wrapped inside an AnnotatedPluginDocument then this method will be overridden and delegate back to AnnotatedPluginDocument.getName(). One way to look at it is that when you call PluginDocument.getName() you will get the current name of the document. If you are implementing PluginDocument.getName() then you are returning the default name for the document.

        Specified by:
        getName in interface PluginDocument
        Returns:
        document name. Cannot be null but may be an empty string.

      • getURN

        public URN getURN()
        Description copied from interface: PluginDocument
        A Universal Resource Name.

        Documents from external sources should set this to a unique name inside that service. Documents generated locally (such as from operations) and documents that don't have a unique identifier should return null since Geneious handles URNs for these.

        Specified by:
        getURN in interface PluginDocument
        Returns:
        the urn, or null if this document doesn't have a unique identifier

      • getCreationDate

        public Date getCreationDate()
        Description copied from interface: PluginDocument
        Get the date this document was created. This method may return null. Generally clients should use AnnotatedPluginDocument.getCreationDate() instead as that will return either the date returned from PluginDocument.getCreationDate() or if that returned null, AnnotatedPluginDocument.getCreationDate() will return the date the document was first instantiated.
        Specified by:
        getCreationDate in interface PluginDocument
        Returns:
        the date this document was created or null to use the date the document was first instantiated.
        See Also:
        PluginDocument.MODIFIED_DATE_FIELD

      • getDescription

        public String getDescription()
        Description copied from interface: PluginDocument
        A human readable single line of text describing this document, to appear in the description field in the document table.
        Specified by:
        getDescription in interface PluginDocument
        Returns:
        a one line simple text description of the document, or null if no description is available.

      • toHTML

        public String toHTML()
        Description copied from interface: PluginDocument
        Provide a textual view of document. The contents should be at most 30K-60K characters. One reason is that this text is rendered using JTextPane, which is horrendously slow when handling large text. The more fundamental reason is that large amounts of text are generally not useful for a user. The whole idea of using a tool such as Geneious is to provide specialized viewers which make the large amount of bioinformatics data perceivable and comprehensible to a human user.

        Return an HTML body fragment (i.e. a fragment which sits inside a <body></body> tag). (Header,stylesheet and annotations are automatically added by GENEious code).

        Can optionally return an entire html tag set, as long as the first six characters are <html>

        Specified by:
        toHTML in interface PluginDocument
        Returns:
        an HTML fragment of tag set, or null to have no text view.

      • getVersionSupport

        public Geneious.MajorVersion getVersionSupport(XMLSerializable.VersionSupportType versionType)
        Description copied from interface: XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible
        Gets either the latest version this class can serialize to via XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible.toXML(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.Geneious.MajorVersion, jebl.util.ProgressListener) or the most recent version in which the XML returned from XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible.toXML(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.Geneious.MajorVersion, jebl.util.ProgressListener) last changed.
        Specified by:
        getVersionSupport in interface XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible
        Parameters:
        versionType - specifies which version property to return
        Returns:
        the major version of Geneious corresponding to the versionType for this classes toXML method.

      • toXML

        public org.jdom.Element toXML()
        Description copied from interface: XMLSerializable
        Convert object to a JDOM element. The representation should be complete so that XMLSerializable.fromXML(org.jdom.Element) can completely restore the objects representation.

        It is recommended that the returned element use XMLSerializable.ROOT_ELEMENT_NAME as its name, in which case it must not define an attribute called "type". In this case, fromXML, will be called with an element whose name may differ from the element return from this function. This recommendation allows a more compact representation of the XML can be stored.

        This method generally should not be called directly. Instead, you should usually call XMLSerializer.classToXML(String, XMLSerializable) which calls this method internally.

        PluginDocument implementations of this method may choose to throw an XMLSerializationException, enclosed in a RuntimeException.

        Specified by:
        toXML in interface XMLSerializable
        Returns:
        object encoded as a JDOM element

      • toXML

        public org.jdom.Element toXML(Geneious.MajorVersion version,
                     ProgressListener progressListener)
        Description copied from interface: XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible
        Serializes this class to XML format, potentially to a format readable by an earlier version of Geneious. It is acceptable for the XML to include unnecessary tags that will be ignored by the earlier version. For example if the implementation has only extended the XML since the earlier version, then the XML returned may be identical to the XML returned for the current version.

        See XMLSerializable.toXML() for a more detailed description of what it means to serialize to XML.

        All classes that implement this method must also implement XMLSerializable.toXML() and should delegate back to this method using Geneious.getMajorVersion() and ProgressListener.EMPTY as parameters.

        Specified by:
        toXML in interface XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible
        Parameters:
        version - the major version of Geneious to serialize to XML for. For example "6.0" but not "6.0.0". This must be a version returned greater or equal to a version returned from getVersionSupport(VersionSupportType.OldestVersionSerializableTo) and must never be greater than the current version (Geneious.getMajorVersion())
        progressListener - for reporting progress and cancelling
        Returns:
        object encoded as a JDOM element

      • fromXML

        public void fromXML(org.jdom.Element element)
             throws XMLSerializationException
        Description copied from interface: XMLSerializable
        Restore the object from the JDOM Element returned by XMLSerializable.toXML().

        This method generally should not be called directly. Instead, you should usually call XMLSerializer.classFromXML(org.jdom.Element) or XMLSerializer.classFromXML(org.jdom.Element, Class) which calls this method internally.

        It is optional to implement this method. Instead of implementing an empty constructor and implementing this method properly, the implementation may instead throw an UnsupportedOperationException and implement a constructor that takes a single Element as a parameter. This allows for cleaner code such as support for final fields in the XMLSerializable class.

        The element parameter should not be modified since it may be reused. If you need a modified version of it, take a copy with Element.clone().

        Specified by:
        fromXML in interface XMLSerializable
        Parameters:
        element - representation from a previous call to XMLSerializable.toXML()
        Throws:
        XMLSerializationException - if the Element can't be converted into this type of object

      • linkDocumentsInDatabase

        public void linkDocumentsInDatabase(ProgressListener progressListener)
                             throws DocumentOperationException
        Links the documents in this record together. The parent and output documents must all be in the same database root WritableDatabaseService.getDatabaseRoot(). This OperationRecord will be added to the database, linking to the parent and output documents. The parent and output documents will also be linked to the newly added operation record.

        This method is intended for use with code that manually links documents. DocumentOperations should instead use DocumentOperation.OperationCallback#setOptionsForActivelyLinkedDescendants(org.jdom.Element, java.util.List, java.util.List)
        Parameters:
        progressListener - for reporting progress and cancelling
        Throws:
        DocumentOperationException - if there is a problem applying these changes (e.g. can't save to database)
        DocumentOperationException.Canceled - if the progress listener requests the operation be cancelled.
        IllegalStateException - if setFinishedAddingOutputDocuments() has already been called on this document.

      • setOutputDocumentActive

        public boolean setOutputDocumentActive(URN urn,
                              boolean active)
        Sets whether or not the output document with this URN is active.
        Parameters:
        urn - the urn of the document, which must be a value returned from getOutputDocuments()
        active - whether or not this output document should be actively linked.
        Returns:
        true if the active status of the urn changed.

      • setAllOutputDocumentsActive

        public void setAllOutputDocumentsActive(boolean active)
        Equivalent to calling setOutputDocumentActive(URN, boolean) on each document returned from getOutputDocuments()
        Parameters:
        active - whether or not all the output documents should be actively linked.

      • replaceOutputDocument

        public boolean replaceOutputDocument(URN originalUrn,
                            URN newUrn)
        Replaces the URN of an output document with a new one. This is intended for use with core code when duplicating documents. Plugins shouldn't need to use it.
        Parameters:
        originalUrn - the original URN
        newUrn - the new URN to use instead of the original URN
        Returns:
        true if anything was changed

      • replaceInputDocument

        public boolean replaceInputDocument(URN originalUrn,
                           URN newUrn)
        Replaces the URN of an output document with a new one. This is intended for use with core code when duplicating documents. Plugins shouldn't need to use it.
        Parameters:
        originalUrn - the original URN
        newUrn - the new URN to use instead of the original URN
        Returns:
        true if anything was changed

      • rerunOperation

        public void rerunOperation(ProgressListener progressListener)
                    throws DocumentOperationException
        Reruns an operation, replacing all output documents of the operation with their corresponding new document
        Parameters:
        progressListener - a ProgressListener
        Throws:

        Since:
